meanings.definition: To mark or pile stones as a memorial or landmark.
meanings.sent1: We cairned the path to remember our hiking adventure.
meanings.sent2: The hikers cairned the trail to guide others.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels cairned acorns to save for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cairned the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist cairned the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The cairned hill stood out against the green landscape.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were cairned with moss and ivy.
meanings.sent3: The cake was cairned with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: His face was cairned with dirt after playing outside.
meanings.sent5: The night sky was cairned with twinkling stars.
